intro: Hippomarathrum scabrum, commonly known as the rough burrplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive, spiny bracts. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its rough, hairy leaves and persistent, woody stems contribute to its rugged appearance. Hippomarathrum scabrum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
